editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Moving’s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

name: A Little to the Left: Stars

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addictive gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche you’ll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colourful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.
editorialNotes.short: Hit the slopes and outrun the avalanche.

editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: A Dance of Fire and Ice

editorialNotes.standard: How do you build a kingdom? By galloping around and flinging gold at people, then seeing how they help you. That’s the great thing about this deceptively deep survival game—how amazing you feel when you figure out everything from securing laborers to mounting defenses against monsters. And finding all the secrets (like a unicorn that drops gold) will keep you busy for ages.
editorialNotes.short: Charge into this captivating struggle to survive in hostile territory.

editorialNotes.standard: So much more than a simple action game, Duet elevates the act of dodging falling blocks into something captivating, beautiful, even profound. A stirring soundtrack and striking visuals almost guarantee you’ll lose yourself in each stage, and as you learn the patterns and find yourself avoiding obstacles by sheer instinct, you’ll feel an overwhelming surge of triumph.
editorialNotes.short: Two vessels play out life’s duality.

ios.subtitle: enjoy your Game on your Watch

editorialNotes.standard: If you think the concept of simply jumping over objects in an endlessly side-scrolling landscape sounds too basic, think again. This tough-as-nails platformer plays more like a relentless obstacle race, throwing out spikes, pits, and multi-tier pathways that demand impeccable timing to avoid and navigate. Your reflexes and memory will be put to the test.
With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Revenge is a dish served with epic property damage and plenty of attitude when a princess and her pet dragon decide they’re tired of getting captured. It’s pure destructive joy guiding this royal duo over (and under) a gorgeous fantasy landscape of fleeing knights, treacherous traps, and mighty bosses to smash. The game pops with personality—and its simple controls, slick level design, and upgradable equipment keep the challenge fun and fresh.

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level
